conclusion: Analyze the path of the liquid from each starting point (A, B, C, and D) to see where it ends up.
Liquid from A will hit the red baffle first.
Red baffle is angled downward to the right, directing liquid towards the purple baffle.
Purple baffle is angled downward to the left, directing liquid towards the black baffle.
Black baffle is angled downward to the right, directing liquid towards the orange baffle.
Orange baffle is angled downward to the left, directing liquid into container E.
Liquid from B will hit the red baffle first.
Red baffle is angled downward to the right, directing liquid towards the purple baffle.
Purple baffle is angled downward to the left, directing liquid towards the black baffle.
Black baffle is angled downward to the right, directing liquid towards the orange baffle.
Orange baffle is angled downward to the left, directing liquid into container E.
Liquid from C will hit the purple baffle first.
Purple baffle is angled downward to the left, directing liquid towards the black baffle.
Black baffle is angled downward to the right, directing liquid towards the orange baffle.
Orange baffle is angled downward to the left, directing liquid into container E.
Liquid from D will hit the pink baffle first.
Pink baffle is angled downward to the right, directing liquid towards the cyan baffle.
Cyan baffle is angled downward to the left, directing liquid towards the yellow baffle.
Yellow baffle is angled downward to the right, directing liquid into container F.
Liquid from starting points A, B, and C will flow into container E.
Liquid from starting point D will flow into container F.
